Reviews.Title: “So convenient, and such a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Haleykolosso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location, only 4 blocks from the light rail. They have a fast and free shuttle to and from seatac airport. There's no continental breakfast, but there's a Denny's a few doors down. There's a coffee maker in our room and also in the lobby. The wifi works well. And the flat screen tv is a really nice touch. For only 50 dollars a night this hotel is an unbeatable day. I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and frill free hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellysiab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the evening before our international flight to Japan. The staff were wonderful. I had a 2:30 am shuttle to the airport with a lot of luggage and a crated cat. The driver was super helpful with our bags. The front desk let us store our excess luggage in a closet off of the lobby so that we didn't need to haul it up to our room, which was really nice. The room was very basic, but clean and comfortable. For the price, it is perfect. They have upgraded rooms with microwaves and fridges, too.

Reviews.Title: “We chose this hotel 3 times in 2 weeks - Good Price/Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Sandy B
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised with almost everything at this hotel (which I did not choose) because my previous experience with a Red Roof Hotel in Washington DC was completely the opposite in every way. I was really pleased with the hotel staff and the cleanliness of the room. I slept soundly with no outside noise and the room was large enough to accomodate our five suitcases and other bags. We spent the night here before our trip to Hawaii and I was so impressed that again I spent a night when I had to return unexpectedly to Seattle on my own. I felt like the staff really cared about their guests by offering suggestions for close places to eat and just being friendly, yet professional. I felt completely safe during my stay and I returned two days later when my flight was cancelled due to bad weather in Texas. I really appreciated the manager for extending my checkout time a little to finish repacking those five suitcases. My only complaints would be the fact that there was only one washcloth per room, even if it had two beds. I also would have liked the parking lot elevator to be a bit cleaner. I am not sure how often they check it out, or if they have enough cleaning staff, but it needed attention. I would return here the next time I am in Seattle and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Thank you so much Red Roof Hotel staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for pre-airport stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda781
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to the airport. The shuttle from the hotel to the airport was on time, I signed up for the shuttle in the early morning and it was on time. I am a younger female, traveling by myself and I felt safe. The room was clean and fairly comfortable and smelled fresh (thankfully! The halls however smelled like old smoke). I would probably not recommend staying for more than a night or two (the beds weren't real comfortable), but over night before or after a flight was definitely fine. I would stay there again if I got a good deal on the room again.

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you are looking for a park, sleep and fly”
Reviews.Author: northgang
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at a near by Hilton hotel... Ended deciding to try Red Roof as the stay would almost be for free if you consider a week of free parking. It was a good choice. The hotel was clean and had all the basics you could expect... Transportation to-from Seatac was very easy (you can book your place in advance if you wish) and quite important in our case, the car was safe (I was lucky to get an individual spot underneath the hotel - couldn't ask for better than this). All in all if you just need one night and are going to spend money on parking, Red Roof is a decent option

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, decent for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: thevinoman
Reviews.Content: Had an early flight from SeaTac. Got a good rate. Not the best neighborhood, but a decent clean place. Front desk was very friendly. No breakfast, only coffee, but that's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripjimbc
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a group that booked several rooms in this hotel so I'm not sure on what price we paid for the rooms (sign outside was advertising $69.00/room). You get what you pay for here - the rooms were decent (if a little large for what was in them - lots of space for luggage or even another bed) and clean. I noticed a few narrow places where it looked like they couldn't get the vacuum in very well but the bathroom was great and the sheets and bedding were clean. Service was excellent and the front desk got us settled very quickly and even offered to provide us with shuttle service to a restaurant if we needed it (we decided to walk). I slept fairly well (although others in our group did not). The bed was "firm" and had the feel of being a solid budget mattress (no pillow top here but not sagging either). The pillows were OK - I like flatter pillows and these were pretty puffy but not super firm so they flattened out nicely. My only complaint would be the sheets and blankets - the sheets seemed pretty thin and had a worn feel to them, the blankets were obviously fairly low quality polyester. But for the price wasn't expecting more - for an overnight budget trip or a night before a flight they were fine. Room was cold when we arrived (heat not on) but warmed up pretty quick. No problem with noise from other rooms or flights. Bathroom looked like it had had a basic Bathfitter's reno with a few extra touches. My only complaint was the complimentary soap and shampoo - really didn't smell too good, kind of a Dollar Store feel and smell to it. Make sure to bring your own! Wireless was excellent - had no problem connecting with my MacBook. Great signal and good bandwidth. Other facilities like the business lounge (?) and the fitness room were pretty basic. Don't book this hotel solely for the fitness room as you'll be very disappointed : ). Coffee only in the morning, no continental breakfast. Several restaurants nearby within walking distance. We ate breakfast at the Denny's a couple of blocks down and had dinner at pub further down. Overall this was good value for the money - basic overnighter hotel. If I was flying out of Seatac and needed a place to crash I'd probably book again.

Reviews.Title: “More Like Red District Inn”
Reviews.Author: Callie b
Reviews.Content: Horrible stay! Only got 3 hours of sleep because you can hear every step someone makes above you. Stains all over the sheets. There was a black hair on top of our blanket. Very hard beds. I had to sleep on top of the lumpy pillows that were provided. Was not very clean at all. There was even a hair stuck on the bathroom door. I went to take a shower and they didn't even have conditioner, just shampoo. I called the front desk to see if they had any conditioner and they didn't, and when we needed more shampoo, they couldn't even bring it to our room. We had to go down and get it ourselves! Way over priced for a crappy stay. WAS NOT IMPRESSED at all. I would not advise staying here. The outside is a lot nicer looking than the inside. Don't let them fool you!

Reviews.Title: “Bad from the start”
Reviews.Author: quiltygirl52
Reviews.Content: I called way ahead of time to make arrangements for my sleep, park and fly. I called them as I saw a review that they didn't have their reservation with an online reserve. So I made a reservation for the night before our flight and night we get in, as I didn't want to drive 3 hrs at 11 PM at night. Well when I got there they didn't have me reserved for a sleep, park, fly. they were going to charge me for the room twice if I wanted it. I felt they should have just added the cost of the SPF, but no. I went next door to Master to park my car. cost me more. The room was just adequate is all I can say. Walked in and immediately started to sneeze and my nose started to run. The sink didn't have a plug and it was partially plugged. The toilet was also sluggish. Another guest had booked a non smoking room and was given a smoking room. I will never stay in this place ever again. The only positive thing I can say is the price but there again I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: genelle w
Reviews.Content: We stay here when we are overnighting enroute to more exotic locations. Great value, clean and large rooms, free coffee, free parking, literally 5 minutes from the parking lot to the rental car return lot! Nice staff, always helpful and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: msjarv
Reviews.Content: I had a really good experience at this motel. The staff was very friendly. The room was really big and clean. I would definitely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: jmp572
Reviews.Content: My husband and I broke up our travel on our way to Hawaii. We stayed here just for one night. We arrived around 5pm, left around 5:30am. Shuttle service was prompt, room was clean, and Denny's was within walking distance to grab an inexpensive meal. Staff was friendly and very helpful! The shuttle is shared with another hotel (Holiday Inn I believe) so look for the Red Roof Inn logo on the wind shield!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: Vivianne G
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent - all the people behind the front counter were welcoming and super-helpful! The room was clean and larger than most budget hotel rooms. The bed was comfy. I really liked the pillows. Wi-fi worked well. The exercise room (two treadmills and one creaky elliptical) was serviceable. The shuttle runs every 20 minutes to/from the airport. There is a decent Asian restaurant two buildings down the road. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get what you ask for here...”
Reviews.Author: Sheilah C
Reviews.Content: Room was supposed to be non-smoking. However, it was smoked in so the room had been over perfumed with some kind of fragrance that made me physically ill. The window was wide open trying to air the room out and it was 39 degrees outside. We had a reservation for a king bed in the back away from the street and airport. They only had two queens left when we arrived. I would only recommend staying here if you are someone who can sleep anywhere and have low standards for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to park and fly”
Reviews.Author: molly2kit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November for the 2nd time using the Park and Fly option. The room was quite nice and very clean. We used the Denny;s coupon they gave at checkin for dinner - very nice. The shuttle was on time both dropping us off and picking us up 19 days later. The shuttle driver who picked us up suggested a different route north to Vancouver as we would be in rush hour traffic. I think he saved us at least 30 minutes. Will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a dancing conference and was late one morning. The shuttle didn't arrive on time so the manager took me in his personal car! They were always super helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: seni0rtripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here both before our early flight to Europe and again on the way back. Among our fellow guests, we noticed, were other senior travellers as well as young families who have also discovered this hotel. Its location is very near the airport, and free shuttle service is available every 20 minutes. Since we look for good value and basic comfort in our accommodations when we travel rather than glamour, this hotel filled the bill. We asked the friendly staff person at the desk for a room on the top floor since we had read in other reviews that this hotel can be noisy, and we received a spacious room with a huge bathroom in a quiet corner of the building. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Travellers should be aware, however, that this hotel has no restaurant. But there is a international chain restaurant just down the street with great food and terrific deals for breakfast. Coffee is available in the lobby area downstairs for those who need a kickstart before heading for the restaurant. The first night of our stay, we took advantage of the SoundTansit light rail from the station located down the street to explore downtown Seattle. The ride into the heart of the city on this sleek, fast rail system was fun and took us right into the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money.”
Reviews.Author: Paula W
Reviews.Content: If you have an early morning flight don't waste your time or money here. I had to fly out at 6am and the hotel was loud until about 3. The walls were paper thin and I could here people walking around upstairs. I got no sleep and wold not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Reliable”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: I was only staying there 1 night in order to catch an early flight the following morning. The staff was efficient, the room was clean and quiet, the wake-up call was precisely when I wanted it, the free shuttle service was on time. These were the important things for me. I didn't care that there was no microwave or frig as I didn't need to use either and was happy not to pay for amenities I was not going to use. The small coffee maker in the room didn't work but there was coffee in the lobby, it was no big deal. I would DEFINITELY stay there again. It was great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you're planning on seeing Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: paulyv24
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline as part of my first trip to Seattle. The location is perfect. It's right across from the airport and right near the train into Seattle. The rooms were spacious and I had a balcony (not exactly a great view but I wasn't staying in the Alps). There's tons of places to order food from in the area. The staff was great. The girl at the front desk (cant remember her name it was a different name she had glasses) was extremely helpful and very personable. She gave me tips on what to see and avoid in Seattle. I will specifically book this hotel on my next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet & close to the airport with free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: goodtoglow
Reviews.Content: We parked here for 11 nights while in Florida/ on a Caribbean cruise, and stayed here upon our return home as our flight did not arrive until 12:45am. We parked in a well lit lot and there were no concerns with our vehicle upon our return. We were glad that we kept our vehicle keys, as another nearby park&fly collected ours on a previous trip, which had made us feel uneasy. Shuttle to and from the airport was quick. Service was friendly from front desk staff. Rooms were surprisingly spacious, and the beds were comfortable. The room and bathroom were clean and well lit, although simple. Free Wi-Fi was a very welcomed bonus. For 11 nights of parking plus our stay, we paid only $145 which we consider great value. This will be our go-to park, sleep & fly when we depart from Sea-tac from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn Seattle Airport”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianWoman
Reviews.Content: This place is ok for a night & park & fly. They have a big lot for parking & rates aren't bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, secure and convenient to SEA-TAC”
Reviews.Author: AStarToSteerHerBy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night in August awaiting a flight to Hawaii. The hotel is close to the airport and the shuttle was prompt. We arrived around 10pm and found the front desk staff efficient and friendly. The room was comfortable and clean and furnished with a microwave, mini-fridge, ironing board and iron, hair dryer and coffee maker. Tea and coffee were also available in the lobby. There is a convenience store within walking distance for any essentials. We had no problem with noise and got a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It's really just a nice motel.”
Reviews.Author: averagejoe75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times over the years, most recently last month as I had a early morning flight out of SEA. This is really is just for overnight stays, and nothing more. I know it's been recently renovated in the past couple of years with new furniture and bedding. It's a decent night sleep, and really only worth it if you can get it for under $60/night. Anything more than that, and you might as well stay at Motel 6 down the street. The shuttle doesn't run very often, takes about 30 mins between trips. You also have to book it in advance for the return to the airport. Staff is friendly. The outside of the hotel itself is raggedy and old, especially the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located right near the SEA-TAC airport and offers parking options with your stay. Check-in was fairly efficient and the rooms were fine. The bathrooms were updated and a bit nicer than the room itself. All-in-all it's nothing to write home about but will do for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: marciarose1966
Reviews.Content: Came to Seattle for a weekend get away and was very pleasantly surprised of the over all appearance of the hotel and inside the rooms, very happy. The whole staff of Red Roof were very nice and helpful. We are already planning another trip to Seattle and would like very much to come back to Red Roof Inn......

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice large room with Comfortable queen bed A nice surprise.”
Reviews.Author: dallasrd
Reviews.Content: The Lobby and entrance are a bit run down but the room was great. Large clean and very comfortable. The total for the night was about $60. The tv was old school but ok. The parking lot was full so they comped me a night parking at master park across the street. This was a bit inconveiniant. They only have coffee and tea in the lobby but it was good coffee. Shuttle to airport runs on the hour and every 20 minutes in between. I requested a little extra time to check out and was granted an hour as I was waiting to meet up with someone. Thank you that was an extra mile in my book.

Reviews.Title: “good airport stay”
Reviews.Author: sonatajessica
Reviews.Content: This is a good place if you need a location near the airport. The area is therefore far from being scenic but very convenient, it is just a couple of minutes to drive to the airport. Lots of places to eat around (though mostly fast food). The room was clean and very spacious. I was positively surprised by how quiet it was considering the location and that this is the kind of place where people come and leave at all night and day times. The beds were actually really nice and big! It will not win any beauty contests but for what it is (meaning an airport motel) it is a good one I would say. There was free parking and they offer a shuttle service which we didn't need though.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: l1jjc0x
Reviews.Content: The property is convenient. The rooms are good sized and clean. Free wifi and cable channels better than average. This is not a marriott but at $58 a night it was a real bargain and its a short walk to some restaurants. If you're looking for the ritz this aint it but given the price of the room ill take it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for overnighter”
Reviews.Author: jco237
Reviews.Content: Practically in the same neighborhood as Seatac airport. Nothin fancy but I flew in late and it was just for overnight. Staff was really nice. Room and bed was comfortable. Will do another overnighter if I visit again. Fresh coffee was abundant. Linens and towels abound.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but ask for a top floor room”
Reviews.Author: nancyvictoria
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this is a basic motel located near SeaTac. The room itself is large, comfy bed, decent linens. Unfortunately, we had a very heavy footed person in the room above us who clomped around endlessly about midnight and got up at 4 a.m. to clomp some more. We used the park-sleep-fly option which is a good value except that it took over 25 minutes for the shuttle to get us at the airport on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Trditional Basic Motel”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganTraveller29
Reviews.Content: crew 347 captured the essence perfectly. "This motel is conveniently located right in front of the SeaTac airport. Rooms are adequate with basic amenities. Although the hallways and pubic areas needed some refurbishing, the room itself was clean and comfortable. Free wifi worked decently. Tea/coffee in the lobby. Convenient, small outside parking. Located next to a Shell Station convenience store. The front desk staff was very friendly. Overall, fine for one overnight close to the airport." Close to rapid transit line to Downtown - very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: JeanandNorm
Reviews.Content: We spent one night before a flight in this hotel. The bed was VERY hard, not much sleep. The hotel itself was clean but not decorated very nicely. The staff was friendly. There was no creamer or sugar with the complimentary in room coffee. No breakfast. We went for the good price bit I guess you get what you pay for. They have parking for customers who are traveling whilr you are away, but you have to book through the hotel not a company like Expedia or others.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: tlcottrell
Reviews.Content: There was nothing special about this hotel. We stayed here because we had an early flight the next day after a trip into Canada. While the rooms were clean, there was a pile of pretzels in the hallway outside another room that stayed there for most of a day. The public areas showed some wear and tear. However, the front desk staff were very helpfull when we asked for a dinner recommendation, although I could tell they were used to dealing with budget-minded travelers when their first concern was the cost. Surface parking was slightly difficult to find and the under hotel parking was a little too dark for my comfort. An OK place to stay for one night for convenience sake.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic airport motel”
Reviews.Author: crew347
Reviews.Content: This motel is conveniently located right in front of the SeaTac airport. Rooms are adequate with basic amenities. Although the hallways and pubic areas needed some refurbishing, the room itself was clean and comfortable. Free wifi worked decently. Tea/coffee in the lobby. Convenient, small outside parking. Located next to a Shell Station convenience store. The front desk staff was very friendly. Overall, fine for one overnight close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Would look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: SPokaneSean
Reviews.Content: In the past we stayed at another hotel down the road that was cheaper, had secure parking, free breakfast, and was clean. The bed was clean and comfortable but that is all I can say good about this place. The room had a smell of smoke and B.O. which was a good warm up since I was heading to NY. It was good prep for the subways. The floor was stained and the common areas were well worn. While nothing happened to our car I did not feel secure leaving it there. To be honest with you the place was gross. The staff was not mean but not real happy to answer questions nor did they seem happy to we were there.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: HeadingWestSara
Reviews.Content: I would say that this hotel is average. It is actually quiet for being so close to the airport. They were updating some of the rooms while we were there. The hotel did seem outdated. Several times we got the very last parking spot in the lot and I am not sure where we would have gone to park. There is no breakfast. The coffee bar they advertise is just coffee with a few creamer choices. I think they throw the term Coffee bar around too loosely. If you are used to staying at 4 star hotels this wouldn't be for you but if you are looking for a place to stay and are not picky..choose this one. Note-Public transportation(train) is about 6 blocks away. You should plan a 30 minute walk. Denny's is about half way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Airport Travelers”
Reviews.Author: dscottdoxy
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Bed was good and comfortable. Free shuttle to airport. Great location for early flight at airport.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed there...”
Reviews.Author: Danelle R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 1 night after our cruise ship came back into port. The staff was very bubbly and helpful! They have a computer set up at the front desk so you can print boarding passes and such. That was awesome! They have a shuttle that takes you right to the SeaTac airport for free. It comes on the hour and at every 20 minutes. They rooms were very clean and spacious. I was a little hestitant to book the hotel because of other reviews, but we were so glad we stayed there. For the price and proximity to the airport, it was perfect. Down the road there are several restaurants. ALSO, they let us check in very early. We would stay there again. Having the washer/dryer available was AWESOME! For $3 you can wash and dry a load of clothes with soap. That was very beneficial just coming off a 7 day cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK!”
Reviews.Author: MD-11P
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Red Roof SeaTac was quite enjoyable indeed, I have not got much to say to the hotel except that we absolutely got what we paid for. A big room with two double beds, a desk, TV and Bathroom and complementary coffee in the lobby at all times. Of course there is aircraft noise as the hotel is very close to the airport. Traffic however is almost non existent after 10:30 PM and the windows are quite good, this was no factor therefore. The room was made up every day as expected, bathroom was not filthy as other travellers suggested. The Inn is located very close to the airport, this means you need to have a car to get downtown quickly, otherwise it should also be possible to take the bus to Tukwila Intl. blvd. station and use the sound transit from there. Reception staff was helpful, we checked out one day early and they arranged a refund so we did not pay for the extra night. Overall I can definetely recommend the Inn to everybody, who does not want to spend too much on an acommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and price was great”
Reviews.Author: JojoL927
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from August 7-10 and then again came back on Aug 12-14. I have to say I booked this last minute actually while i we were at the road coming from California. Rooms are clean and it's near a nice mall and only 10 mins from downtown, which was very convenient. I would definitely stay here and recommend it to people..

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice for a budget hotel - we definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: phil p
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of 6 nights at the sea-tac airport red roof inn. It was quiet, clean and the staff was very helpful and professional. Another big plus is that it is located within walking distance to the Light Rail link that can take one as far as the downtown Seattle waterfront. Everything in the room worked just fine (A/C was great). We were wondering if the airport noise would be a problem (it was not). When it came time to leave, it was nice being able to get a short ride (less than 1 mile) to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: jagnjav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a stop over. It needs a little updating in the rooms, but the price is right. They also accept pets which is a big plus, and it's super close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Inexpensive, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: What this hotel lacks in frills, it makes up for in location, cleanliness, customer service and price. It is is within walking distance to SEATAC and the transit train to downtown Seattle. The rooms may need some cosmetic refurbishing, but they are clean and have the necessary amenities. Besides who stays in the room all day? Finally, the staff is helpful and will go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Oh, the van service to the airport is also timely and staffed by polite drivers who find the time to carry bags into the holel. I would stay at the Red Roof SEATAC again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but can be best...”
Reviews.Author: mitonl
Reviews.Content: Room and other services are good,. Problems with internet connection..worst speed ever...Complained to staff but they had no solution. So if you need good internet dnt come otherwise its a good choice...

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel, the room & the staff-would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: cspoon1
Reviews.Content: In addition, the location was great-light rail a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for airport and easy to get into the city on the rapid train”
Reviews.Author: oncewereworkers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the airport, walking distance to the train to the city and very close to Dennys for a good meal!! The hotel is small but clean and tidy with free coffee/tea,chocolate near the reception area. Handy also is the laundry room which is located right around the corner from Reception and at only $3 for wash and/or dry is very convenient for those who just want to get a pair of jeans washed and dried quickly, The staff are very knowledgeable and helpful. They will even give you a discount voucher for Dennys which is just down the road. No restaurant in this hotel but there is a room with tables and chairs where you can sit and drink your coffee or chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “The people were nice”
Reviews.Author: SomeDudeSteve
Reviews.Content: This is an airport hotel, and an older property. The common spaces and hallways are a bit run-down looking. But the rooms were clean and in good shape, and the staff were friendly and helpful. They has a computer set up from which we could print boarding passes. We ended up spending three nights (one on our arrival in Seattle, and, unexpectedly, two on our departure, after we missed a flight :( ) Check out time was 11 am, but staff were friendly and generous when we asked for noon checkouts. The WiFi worked, but connections were slow, and occasionally, unaccountably, required me to re-log in (press a button on a webpage to re-accept terms of service), which was annoying when it interrupted a long download. The airport shuttle is fine, but it can be bit slow. The hotel is just a few blocks from the airport entrance, but budget a full 40 minutes from when you notify reception that you need it. For us, it took up to 20/25 minutes for the van to show. Plus, the "courtesy van" drop-off at the Seattle airport is terrible (which is not the hotel's fault). All courtesy vans drop you on the third floor of the parking lot. You have to go up an elevator, over a bridge and then up another elevator before you get to the ticketing and baggage drop-off area. As I mentioned, we missed a flight. This wasn't the hotel shuttle's fault -- we screwed up the time, and got a late start. Still, had the shuttle come more quickly it might have saved us from our own incompetence. Overall, we'd recommend this hotel for a Seattle airport overnight, because the rooms were fine, but mostly because the people were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and cheap.”
Reviews.Author: kristinananana
Reviews.Content: Well worth the money. I didn't want to spend a lot but wanted to make sure I had a clean hotel. This is exactly what I wanted, a clean, simple, affordable hotel. I only stayed one night but wouldn't have had any problem staying longer. Comfortable beds, helpful staff, good parking. No breakfast but still worth it. Didn't take long to drive to from downtown Seattle but I was driving late at night and around noon so I don't know how long it takes during peak times/with traffic. I booked through hotels.com and got the same room $20 cheaper than the rate the hotel gave me.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go there again”
Reviews.Author: SeanRegina
Reviews.Content: Bed was not clean and the room had a weird smell. They didn't let us to open the window to get rid of smell.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: MICH618
Reviews.Content: They all couldn't have been any nicer. Warm & welcoming. Hotel was within walking distance to the shuttle to downtown & the airport. Comfortable & clean. I'd recommend & stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Offered a military discount”
Reviews.Author: sas411
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful. The room was very clean and the beds were excellent. The motel is about 4 blocks from the Seattle Monorail which we utilized to get into Seattle. I enjoyed the 24 hour complimentary coffee in the lobby. I would stay here again. There is a Denny's restaurant 2 blocks away; that was about it for nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Dollar”
Reviews.Author: 58687Nick
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for its proximity to the airport and its shuttle service as I had to catch a 6am flight out the next morning due to a family emergency. I'm a retiree and money really matters so this was affordable for me. I must admit, I wasn't expecting anything of quality for what I was paying but BIG surprise! This place was VERY nice! It's clean, had covered parking, nicely decorated and the clerk at the front desk was just wonderful with 4-Star attention to my arrival. My room was non-smoking, very clean, quiet and had everything necessary. The coffee room downstairs got me started the next morning and the shuttle was on-time and very much appreciated. I'd recommend the Red Roof to anyone looking for a nice hotel near SeaTac, not just folks like me on a budget. Any future flying I may do will be via a stay at the Red Roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: davene13
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Red Roof Inn when above and beyond service, I booked my room on the wrong date and was actually a no show and they just set me up with a room. They gave me so much help with my day in Seattle! Not the prettiest hotel in the world but the service is 5 star. Thanks for all the help.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE - I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy”
Reviews.Author: MC6206
Reviews.Content: I reserved a non-smoking king room in advance that was guaranteed by my credit card. When we arrived at the hotel we were given a key to a room that was a double smoking room. The room was disgusting. It looked extremely dirty, and smelt like it had never been cleaned (a combination of stale smoke, trash and maybe a dead body or two). We were not told that we were being given a smoking room when we checked in (and when my credit card was authorized). We went and complained at reception and they told us that we must never had booked a non-smoking room (despite me showing them the reservation email) and that there were no other rooms available in the hotel. I asked if they could find us a room at another hotel nearby and they said no. The woman in reception also said she couldn't guarantee that my credit card wouldn't be charged for the room, seeing I had authorized the credit card. After much protest she agreed to leave a note to her manager about maybe not charging us. So we were left on the street at 1am without a hotel, and had to drive for 20 minutes, and pay double the price of our original reservation for a room at the last minute. This completely ruined the start of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Gloomy, but with good location”
Reviews.Author: Jellona
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal, if you are traveling by plane, since the airport is within walking distance (free shuttle bus is provided, too). We arrived by rental car, dropped the car to the terminal and stayed three nights in the hotel while doing day trips to Seattle before leaving by plane. The light rail station is short walk away and with it Seattle city center is only 30 minutes away. That was suberb. There is no restaurant in the hotel and nearby you can find only some fast food restaurants and mini marts at gas stations, so make sure you eat a decent dinner in Seattle before coming back to the hotel... However, you can order almost any food to the hotel room (this is not provided by the hotel but another company), but it comes with a steep price. The room was really big (and you actually saw Mt. Rainier from the window...), but spartan and dull, just like the corridors (and some hostel rooms I've been to)... But perhaps you are not going to spend your time in the hotel room, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “great value, clean room”
Reviews.Author: 5Artgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Red roof Inn for a stopover at the airport. Them room was super clean, and had new furnishings. We got a terrific price, and used the shuttle to the airport. I would stay here again, as it is close to the airport and more than adequate for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Digs”
Reviews.Author: McInMe
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a single night on a 2-week road trip. Check in was very courteous and while our Expedia Reservation wasn't located by the front desk, she took the confirmation number and assured us she would sort it out with Expedia; and it was. We asked for a room not facing the airport and had no trouble getting one. Our room was reasonably sized (to my surprise) and overlooked some residential backyards, so it was nice and quiet. We had no troubles with anything in the hotel - the elevator was fast, the exterior security doors shut firmly and quickly and we felt comfortable with the area. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the airport free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: P0wens
Reviews.Content: First impressions not great- corridors and room smelled- Security door hanging off.However staff extremely helpful - much more so than they had to be- very friendly. Small gym and laundry services available - clean and good condition - cheap too! Room had everything you could need- not noisy although close to gas station and airport. got used to the smell- only there for one night- not really cheap but not too dear either. the staff made this place without them I would say dont go but with them it was an ok experience

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: joferer
Reviews.Content: Good value, room ok, bathroom nice and clean. Airport shuttle ok, but waited 25 min for a pick up when they said 10. What creeped us out was the scary young men packed 4 or 5 in a car cruising the parking lot in 3 cars blocking people in and getting out to talk to each other. Also parking was full and although we were offered overflow parking in the lot across the street we opted to return our car because of the sketchy parking and do the shuttle route. One elevator was broken, the other, accessed from the parking lot was just creepy. I did not feel safe (except in the room) at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Simple Hotel, Great Staff and Stay”
Reviews.Author: f220
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed over for one night after a long flight into Seattle. Rooms were simple, clean, and not noisy, especially for being so close to the airport. She met up with a friend who drove in, and there were no parking spots available. The hotel paid for valet parking at one of the park and fly lots. Only problem was on arrival in Seattle, the shuttle bus was actually placarded for the Holiday Inn, so she took a taxi to the hotel after trying to find the correct bus.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ffdusty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn after readng the positive reviews from other Trip Advisor members. For the most part I found the other reviews accurate. An older hotel that had been remodelled and for the $101 (taxes included) for a room and 7 days parking it was fine. The staff were very friendly at check in and although the hotel parking lot was full, they sent me across the street to a park and fly lot and the Red Roof picked up the tab for the one night. They retrieved my vehicle when a spot opened up in the hotel lot and the car was there when I returned from our trip. The room itself was plain but clean. My two complaints were the bed wasn't very comfortable and the walls weren't very soundproof. The mattress was thin and firm and we coud hear a TV in the next room at midnight and another guest walking around above us at 4am. We were only there for the one night before our trip so it was OK for the one night, but not sure I'd stay longer than that. The shuttle was very convenient and could handle probably 20 people + luggage per trip. Based on the price it was OK, but I might be inclined to spend the extra $20-$30 somewhere else if I knew I was getting a better sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dantheman33
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle for work and had ended up having a pretty crappy work schedule while we were there. The staff at the Red Roof Inn was so great that we couldn't help but smile and be in a better mood. They were very helpful and even willing to just stand and chat for a while. One of the ladies at the front desk was new and was extremely helpful (and she has a very contagious smile). Although she was new to the area, as well as her job, she helped plan out a fun filled day away from work (and it was much needed) She went up and out of her way to print off directions and sent us to a great restaurant. The manager and the rest of the staff was great as well, always very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very nice. They were big and very clean. It's not a ritzy hotel but I've stayed at "nice" hotels before and never enjoyed myself as much as I did here. I wish it had breakfast, but it's close to a Dennys! I have no real complaints about this hotel, and when I come back to Seattle, even if it's just for fun, I will stay here. It's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel with great shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: lamorris99
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for our needs...we stayed here 1 night at the beginning and 1 night at the end of our recent vacation to Iceland. The flight times didn't match up for us, and so we needed a place to stay for the night. Their airport shuttle runs 24 hours and was quick and clean. You can sign up for the time you need it in the morning - makes it very convenient, and it's right on time. We also asked if they could take us to a restaurant down the street, and they said he could since he wasn't busy. A nice tip got us a pick-up as soon as we called after we were done. The rooms are nice for this class of hotel, I think they were recently remodeled. They have free wifi and also free long distance calls. They offer free coffee just off of the lobby, but it was basically black hot water. Also, check out the Ginger Palace for a nice breakfast...just a short walk outside of the hotel. We had Domino's Pizza delivered and it came very fast!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for overnight layover at SEATAC”
Reviews.Author: nealpolitan
Reviews.Content: The Red Roof Inn at SEATAC airport is a great option for travelers needing a place to stay for an overnight layover. Twice in the last year, I've used it for this purpose and both times I was pleasantly surprised at the stay. It is not fancy or elaborate but the shuttle picked me up at the airport both times with no problems, check-in was quick and easy, the stay was generally peaceful (if you can stand a little traffic noise), and check-out/trip back to the airport was again, easy. One tricky thing, the shuttle is shared with a Holiday Inn and the Holiday Inn logo is most prominent on the bus; the Red Roof Inn logo is in smaller letters and not as prominent. Just check each shuttle carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Great Seatac Option Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter99
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay one night and use the park & fly option. Once we checked in and saw the clean, spacious room for the price, we booked a night for our return trip to Seattle. Staff were very friendly and offered information on where to eat in the area. We used the shuttle to and from the airport and both times it was staffed by quick, friendly and efficient drivers. If you demand the Ritz, don't go, but if all you want is a clean room with transfers and park and fly at a budget price, I recommend this option. We rated sleep quality 4 because we had a heavy footed person overhead who got up very early and awakened us with their clomping around, but hey, I've had this happen at the Hyatt! I did notice that some of the hotels nearby that offered competitive rates looked a bit dubious. We felt quite safe leaving our vehicle, and Red Roof Inn didn't let us down. Thanks to all the great staff!

Reviews.Title: “great park & fly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob58708
Reviews.Content: We left our car here 14 days while in Hawaii. The staff was friendly and helpful, The room was clean and newly refurbished. The airport is just minutes away and the shuttle was prompt and courteous. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD LIKE TO CONTACT JESSICA LEWIS BY EMAIL”
Reviews.Author: elainebe95
Reviews.Content: We have had very good reports about your hotel and would like to make some enquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: akflygirl
Reviews.Content: We spent the night there so we could catch an early flight out of SeaTac. The room was clean and spacious. It was unusally cold for Seattle so it took a while for the room to warm up. Really need a coffee pot in the room. The coffee downstairs was very weak. Other than that, we had a nice, hot shower and the shuttle bus was even early so we didn't have to wait for a ride. Yes, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Clean Room, Professional and Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: renmar01
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight due to a snow storm. When we walked in the door we were welcomed with " are we glad to see you two, we thought you were stuck out there". A room was held for us despite the fact that there was not a room to be found in Seattle for that night. Check-in was quick. We stayed here the night before our trip to Fort Lauderdale and they parked our car for 2 weeks. Next morning our car was ready to go. We will definitely stay here again next May.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldCity66
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice when we've had early morning flights from SEA TAC. Our room was clean and comfortable each time. The location is convenient -- a few blocks walk from the Light Rail station. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the shuttle service to the airport was great. My only negative comment concerns the lack of a coffee maker in the room. We would have appreciated having one, since the coffee in the lobby is too weak for our taste. Overall a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hallidaydm
Reviews.Content: Read a few negative comments abnout this hotle but couldn't resist the value and I'm happy I chose it. It is an older hotel but they have redone all the rooms and the hallways. The rooms are huge by comparrison and hallways nice and wide and well lit. Parked my car for 10 days and you get to park it yourself and keep the keys. The front desk staff were very welcoming and my room was exactly what I had reserved. A lot of the rooms have their own balconies which was very nice. My two room had a microwave and small frodge. I noticed no coffee pot but they have informed me that the coffee pots have arrived! Yhe hotel is so close to the airport so you might hear air traffic but I simply put on the inroom fan and it was sufficient to drown out any noise. The shuttle was quick both coming and going. I arrived late on my return flight and although I did not have a reservation for my return, they were more than accommidating me in the room I needed. All in all I will recommend this hotel to my friends as it is a safe, clean and very comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean n Comfortable for Price”
Reviews.Author: MPD262
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel close to SeaTac airport, after seeing a Seahawks Game. Staff was friendly and inviting. Room was clean and comfortable - nothing fancy. TV and A/C worked fine. There's alot of worries these days about bedbugs. I checked my room out COMPLETELY, looking in small spaces / under sheets and matresses. The room was clean and I felt okay sleeping here. Of the several hotels in the SeaTac airport area, for the price - I would recommend this one and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Agent_L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here both before our cruise and on our return. To make our reservation I called the hotel directly, the reservations agent/receptionist was very helpful and when i told her we were going on a cruise she offered us a great deal on a cruise package. We arrived from the UK, jumped on the shuttle bus (shared with the holiday Inn), stayed one night and was then driven to the new Smith Street Port. Our transfer arrived dead on 11am just as we had been told and was a breeze in a clean and comfortable bus. We were made to feel welcome by the friendly reception staff on our arrival and given clear directions to our room. We were on the 2nd floor towards the back, considering the hotel is so close to the airport there was no noise whatsoever. Our room was spacious, was well equiped and very clean. Our second stay was for 2 nights and we arrived very late, again the reception was just as friendly and helpful and we had the room next door our previous one. Again it was spotlessly clean and comfortable. The hotel is just a 2 block walk from the light rail into Seattle ($2.50). We found this to be very convenient and obviously cheaper than staying downtown. There is also a Denny's a block away, if you want a meal. For the price I don't think you could find a better place to stay in the area, clean, comfortable, convenient and very friendly/helpful staff. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Splichiz
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Red Roof and it was as good as the first time. The service at the front desk is quick and courteous and they are so helpful giving instructions on how to get places. There is a Denny's within walking distance and shopping close by. We use Red Roof for their great deals for extended parking. We have left our car for up to 2 weeks and take the shuttle back from the airport and drive away. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: BrianandCarrell
Reviews.Content: Much cheaper than staying in town, cheaper than most economy motels. Very nice room w/ mini-fridge and microwave, friendly & helpful service. No breakfast snack, but coffee available. 10-12 minute walk from Light Rail station, train takes 35-40 minutes to center of downtown Seattle. Did all our exploring without bothering with car/parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very large rooms and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: slggy
Reviews.Content: My family and I were able to book a room at Red Roof Inn at the last minute for a very great price using a coupon code found online. We arrived at the hotel after 11pm and did not experience any problems checking in. However, parking was a hassle since we had 2 cars filled with furniture and other personal belongings. Parking is FREE but the parking lot was full except for one spot near the street, so we had to find somewhere to park our other car. The front desk lady told me about the commercial parking lot right across the street - I guess they have an agreement with them for overflow parking. The process went something like this: The commercial lot would give me a parking ticket, I leave the car and keys for them to park it, then I would show the ticket to the front desk the next morning to get a receipt, and then I present the receipt to the commercial lot so I don't have to pay for parking. I was kind of disappointed that there were no parking spaces left at the hotel, but I was prepared for it after reading someone else's review on Tripadvisor. The commercial parking lot was directly across the street and took no longer than 1 minute to walk to the hotel. I was concerned with the parking situation because of the amount of stuff we had in the car and we had to leave the key with the parking attendant so he could park the car, but I guess the commercial lot was secured so it was kind of more comforting than parking at the hotel parking lot. We decided to park our other car in the hotel parking lot, but we didn't feel safe parking it in the spot near the street but we left it there over night with no problems. It looked like part of the hotel was undergoing renovations - some of the hall walls and carpet still needed work but the rooms looked like they had already been remodeled. The 2 bed room was very spacious. I wasn't expecting it to be that spacious but it was very nice to have the extra room for some of our luggage and other stuff. We found most everything to be somewhat clean. The bathroom could have used more towel racks. Other than that and no breakfast, no other complaints. Wireless internet worked well. The next morning, we decided to leave our cars at the hotel for a few hours after checkout so that we could take the lightrail to downtown Seattle and avoid traffic and parking. The front desk lady said that it would be ok to park our cars at the hotel while we went downtown. The shuttle to the airport says Holiday Inn on it but there's a paper sign with Red Roof Inn printed on it. The shuttle was very convenient. The airport is also within walking distance down International Blvd - less than 5 minute walk to the skywalk/bridge. I know because we decided to walk it on the way back from the airport instead of taking the shuttle. We had a really good experience with Red Roof Inn and would stay there again next time we're in the Seattle area. I would also recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Helpful Service at Seatac Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: abbottjga
Reviews.Content: We had just completed a vacation trtip through the Canadian Rockies and were looking for a place to stay for the night before flying home. Close friends had recommended the Red Roof Inn at the Seattle Airport. From checkin to checkout, every person we dealt with at the hotel was friendly, courteous, and helpful. When we discovered that we had left my wife's I-Phone in our room, we called the hotel from the airport. Jessica returned our call and I could sense immediately that we were in good hands. After checking our room, she called us back with the good news that she had our phone. We made arrangements for her to send the I-Phone directly to our home. As promised, the phone arrived the morning after we arrived home. We now understand why our friends had recommended the Red Roof Inn to us. We will certainly recommend the hotel to our friends who will be flying in or out of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “great room for the $”
Reviews.Author: islandgirllil
Reviews.Content: We had a 12 hour layover in Seattle so got a room for the day at this hotel. The room was very large with a desk, king bed and tv with premium channels. It was very clean and bathroom had all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Free Stay is NOT Worth Staying at this Hotel...Don't Waste Your Time”
Reviews.Author: Cruisingncmama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before an Alaskan cruise in May...what an awful experience. It started out okay...arrived at the hotel around 10 pm, checked in and noticed to start with the lack of amenities for guests. From there, we checked out our room, it was not up to the standards of even a standard hotel room but I did feel as if it was clean enough to stay in for one night, and I'm picky when it comes to cleanliness. The next morning, we wake up after having a lack of sleep due to the fact that the building has no sound barriers whatsoever. Everything everyone was doing above us was heard all through the night. If I had a vehicle, I would have slept in it better. A vehicle brings up another subject. The shuttle driver was very polite and offered to drive us to the Denny's a few blocks down since it was a slow night for him and we had just checked in. I was going to walk from the Holiday Inn and just get dropped off there since it was a shorter walk but he agreed to just drop us off there. After dinner, we called our driver as he advised us to do and guess what? The girls at the front desk tells us that's against their rules and they cannot send him to pick us back up. So, here I am with a 3-year old walking down a street in Seattle at 11 pm with him and my elderly grandmother who cannot walk far distances, much less up and down hills to the hotel. In addition to all of this, after the walk and the lack of sleep to add to our stay was the toilet that had overrun into the floor and out into the hallway. The front desk offered to let us shower in another room, 5 rooms down but it's not the easiest thing to do carrying all of our belongings down to wait on one another to shower while holding up the process of preparing to leave this 1-star hotel. Oh, and the view out of the window was an older house which without the trashy yard was an eyesore, and a large mass of briar bushes. Not a pleasant stay at all! Save your time, sleep somewhere else. It's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel for one night”
Reviews.Author: Palal
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and large (stayed in one with 2 double beds), but this feels like a 2* hotel. The decor feels dated. This hotel uses the same shuttle as the Holiday Inn a few doors down and it runs frequently. If you don't have luggage it's about a 10-minute walk from the terminal via the light rail station. Good for a one-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a step down from Courtyard Marriott or similar”
Reviews.Author: david_tanya
Reviews.Content: II had never stayed at a Red Roof Inn before and needed a hotel near the airport to catch an early morning flight out of Seatac airport. I figured that the Red Roof Inn (based on the rave reviews) would be a somewhat scaled down version of a Hilton Garden Inn or Courtyard Marriott or the like. I was wrong. This is quite a downgrade from those hotels. It has the feel of a cheap motel – it smells strange, the carpet/décor is awful, and the hotel feels a bit like an institution. With that said, the rooms were clean and if you’re looking for cheap and functional, then this is an OK choice. We only paid $60 (tax included) for this place. If I had paid any more, I would have felt ripped off. I would recommend that you look for a three star hotel – even if you have to pay a bit more – rather than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “the red-roof is a great choice”
Reviews.Author: iwannacruise
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed my stay at the red-roof seatac. i got a great price on expedia. the check in and out was easy and they were very friendly. they put our luggage in a locked room because we got there early. we were given rooms in the new section. the room was very clean and the shower had great water pressure . the bed was very comfortable and i slept great. looking out the window showed a backyard in need of cleaning up but i just shut the cutains and i heard no noise. the airconditioner worked great. they had free coffe in the lounge. we walked too the light-rail ( a good 4 block walk but easy too do ) and had no trouble getting on it and going back downtown for the day. a gas station was right next door so we could pick up sodas and snacks too have in the rooms. the only negative thing i found was the timing of the free shuttle to seatac for our flight out. they share a van with the holiday inn and say they run every 20 minutes. they picked us up 20 minutes late and it was full of passengers. by the time they put in our luggage and dropped every one off at the designated airlnes we were cutting it kind of close on time. besides that it is a great place too stay for the price and i will stay there again. even though it is a 2 star i was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: raywheeler
Reviews.Content: although i believe it or not the room that we had i never heard an airplane but i did hear the bin men!!! staff were pleasant, only had luxury room left but let us have it at a reduced price coz we said we were out first thing in morning so all good, room clean, bed nice clean sheets, shower good, thats were it ends for me coz thats all that matters and this is a airport hotel so no views or anything else to comment on, except maybe the really weak coffee in the morning that you have to go downstairs to, really not worth bothering, although when we were down in the coffee room we did see coffee makers in boxes which would have been lovely to have had in the room, ho hum !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a brief stay”
Reviews.Author: tnewmy12
Reviews.Content: We flew into Seattle and stayed here before and after our drive down to Oregon. It was clean and had everything we needed. The airport shuttle was convenient. The only downfall is that there is no continental breakfast. If you're going to Seattle to sight see I would recommend somewhere closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for that 1 night stopover....but bring your breakfast with you....”
Reviews.Author: ianjmorley
Reviews.Content: For a one night stay this was fine and great value for money. Friendly staff, large and clean room. There is a coffee machine downstairs but no means of getting any breakfast. Only option is to go to the gas station next door. Its a cheap motel but friends stayed in a best western that offered complimentary breakfast and the price was only $5 more.....

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs”
Reviews.Author: jerryh52
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a nine night stay at this property. Our room was clean, well maintained and we felt safe there. The amenities were basic but that worked out fine for us as we only slept there. The front desk personnel were friendly and, to the best of their ability, helpful. The only negative that we experienced was in the parking area. We were approached by panhandlers and there was evadence of unseemly activity that appeared between the cars in the mornings. To the hotels credit, they do have numerous security cameras in the lot. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: michellesmith201
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, nice park and fly package, friendly staff, housekeeping was extremely attentive, rooms were very clean. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others to stay also.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good rate, free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: shebrightoned
Reviews.Content: BOOK ONLINE and save $10. When we checked in, unfortunately I had reserved the following night and they were not expecting us. However, they did have room, and still provided the online rate, with some insistence. They initially tried to charge the regular rate at $10 higher. Slept okay, but the bed was oddly bouncy/springy so my husband and I slept in separate queen beds. The room was clean and efficient and all the amenities adequate. Yummy coffee machine with all kinds of flavors in the dining area! By far the most decent place to stay for the price in Sea-Tac.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: mollyemm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night before flying to Fort Lauderdale left car for 10 days good price secure parking-shuttle to and from airport prompt

Reviews.Title: “Great no frills place to stay near airport.”
Reviews.Author: EagerAdventurer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before an early morning flight. Very close to the airport and they have a shuttle so that is a nice perk. The rooms are very basic but spotlessly clean! It was obvious the bathrooms had been recently updated, but they should consider an upgrade on the bed linens. (a bit outdated and scratchy) Overall for a quick and reasonable priced overnight it was perfect. We will stay there again when traveling through WA.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and value”
Reviews.Author: igorek
Reviews.Content: I paid $55/night special rate. Nice, clean room; well decorated lobby and hallway; aliitle bit thin walls. If you are taking shuttle bus from the airport: look for the green bus with Holiday Inn logo - Redroof inn logo is much smaller. waiting time ~5min. walking distance (3min) to light rail to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, and very clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastgem
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The clerk was very helpfull in telling us what we needed to know about amenities. We found the location was good, right near the highway, and Safeway among many other things. Seriously, you wouldn't even know you were near an airport! We viewed two rooms on different floors, and both were immaculate. The hotel is completely renovated fresh and clean. In the room we found everything we would need. Their attention to detail was immpressive. I would recommend this location to anyone who seeks the best bang for their buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for Park, Sleep, Fly”
Reviews.Author: kyle2323
Reviews.Content: After searching around and looking for the best deal to park, sleep and fly I came across the Red Roof Inn. After reading reviews of course online here the Red Roof was given the best reviews for the price range it was in. Anyway when we arrived the lady at the front desk was very pleasent and nice. The hotel was kept very clean, and they were doing renovations which didn't affect our stay at all. The room was comfy and cozy. For the price you can not go wrong. I would recommend this hotel to all. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: bobbie1105
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay in a hotel for a night while there was some work being finished in our home. A friend of a friend suggested we look into staying at the Red Roof. We needed someplace affordable that was also clean and comfortable. WE FOUND IT!. The staff was great, the rooms were big and clean, the bed was comfortable and the value was perfect! Now being around an airport you are going to get some noise and all that goes with a very busy area but the noise was not the bad. It didn't keep us up all night. I felt I could even stay there by myself and feel safe. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Room!”
Reviews.Author: BigBabySurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a late flight with my husband and young son. Did not appreciate that the alarm in the room went off at 4:10am in the morning nor the marathon running in the fitness room next to our suite. We were given a choice of rooms to stay and the check-in clerk for some reason put us in a room beside the fitness center. At 5:50 in the morning, our room was shaking from the person running on the treadmill beside our room! The room was clean but not worth it for the terrible night of sleep! Complained to the front-clerk the next day without much sympathy. Have sent in a complaint letter to this hotel and have yet to hear their response. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best by Far”
Reviews.Author: GmoneyRevelstoke
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Red Roof as we were only planning on staying 3 days, and it was such good value and so handy that we ended up staying 11 days. The rooms are basic but have all the amenities. The staff were amazing and no matter what time day or night they were always ready to answer our questions with a smile on their face. The hotel has a free shuttle to the airport which connects you straight into Seattle via light rail. You get to see a lot more of the beautiful city by travelling light rail and I highly recommend getting off at varied locations and just walking. I will definitely be staying there again on my next trip to Seattle. Thanx guys

Reviews.Title: “Convenient , clean, good value.”
Reviews.Author: KJDJdelta
Reviews.Content: Close to airport, recently rennovated and very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay but don't book ahead”
Reviews.Author: magdog17
Reviews.Content: Great overnight stay and bonus...with your room you get free parking at the hotel if you are flying BUT do NOT book this hotel early, you will not be able to leave your car there for free. If you book it through a thrid party such as Expedia or Travelocity EVEN trough redroofinn.com you will not be able to ge the free parking. You have to just take your chances that there will be a room when you get there. I booked our room through Expedia and got a great deal then ended up spending another $140 to leave my car in a parking garage while I was gone.

Reviews.Title: “Dropping the ball.”
Reviews.Author: joshj1984
Reviews.Content: The price was reasonable. I could understand the outdated interior. I can not however forgive the front desk man for forgetting our wake up call thus causing us to miss our flight out. His words "If I have to come and knock on the door I will make sure you guys are awake". This however is not how things ended up. It really put a bad taste in my mouth because then I spent several hours in lines at the airport trying to make new travel plans. Everyone know that is not something you want to do 2,000 miles away. Also the shuttle is shared with a Holiday Inn which was over crowded because the driver was not paying attention and allowed it to be overloaded. One good thing was that the room was had was very roomy. No complaints of being over cramped and this was with 3 22-25 year old guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Red Roof Inn Seatac. Just stayed one night at the beginning of our trip and one night at the end but both nights were perfect. Rooms were very clean, front desk staff were wonderful and the location was perfect right near the airport, who could ask for more??? Free shuttle to and from the airport too. Definitely recommended by me and my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing -- Service not up to Red Roof Standards”
Reviews.Author: MoFloChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Up until this stay I have been a confirmed Red Roof customer -- expecting fresh, clean, comfortable accommodations with only basic amenities and service that is both excellent and friendly. This hotel falls down on both accounts. The recently rehabbed rooms are fine, but elements of the public areas (for example the elevator lobby in the parking area) need either cleaning or paint or both. Service was worse. At check-in there were 3 workers at the desk, but only one working (one was watching the person working while literally picking his nose, and other was staring at a computer screen but taking no visible action) -- and the one person working took forever to check in the two guests ahead of us. Later, upon return from dinner, we found no available parking (although some spots were blocked off by orange cones, presumably to keep them available for employees). Upon inquiry, I was told the hotel would pay for me to park in the "overflow lot," which is a commercial lot about a block away. When I asked for an explanation, I was told that the hotel rents parking spaces to long-term travelers and for that reason runs out of space for guests. It's frequent enough that they have a voucher arrangement established with the commercial lot. This could be better managed so that the hotel does not inconvenience its core customers this way; as is, the practice is unacceptable. Despite my protests both when I was being told to park in the other lot and when I picked up the voucher to present to the lot, there was not a hint of apology from the hotel staff. As for the hotel's location -- it could not be more convenient to the airport unless it were located in the terminal, but if there is a restaurant in walking distance, I did not see one.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: vjl330
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of 8 nights here.There were no problems at check in.The staff is pleasant but I wouldn't say especially friendly.We requested the new king rooms in the renovated section.Comfortable beds but had the cheap soap and towels(I know--it's not the Hilton).Forget about sleeping with the AC off and screen door open.Too much airport noise.Speaking of noise apparently the people above us decided to run laps in their room at 3AM.On 2 occasions the carpet was not vacuumed.It makes you wonder what else they didn't do.Ask at the desk about the discount at Pancake Chef.If you're headed to downtown drive 2 miles to the Light Rail station.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: theraj101
Reviews.Content: My room 152 got broken into and someone STOLE all my stuff including my laptop, suitcase and everything. As of now, the hotel as basically said it is not their liability and their insurance company is not professional at all. The manager has no idea about anything other than what she is trained to do. They are really unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad there's not a Zero star rating”
Reviews.Author: LaCajunTraveler
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel one night (actually just five hours) before flying out to our final destination of Anchorage. Evidently we stayed in one of the areas not yet renovated, as others have mentioned in their reviews. The hallway floors were unfinished cement/glue (evidently in process of renovations,) toilet seats stained with cigarette burns, showers/tubs were icky, the rooms and restrooms were stinky and downright dirty feeling. What's really unfortunate is that due to my own error, we hopped aboard a shuttle to Red Lion Inn instead of Red Roof Inn. The clerk at Red Lion was extremely helpful, called Red Roof Inn, which was just about a mile up the road, and was told they'd send a shuttle to get us. After waiting 45 minutes, it was pretty evident the shuttle was not coming, so the nice clerk at Red Lion graciously offered their hotel's shuttle service. When we finally arrived at Red Roof Inn, the check in clerk (who hardly bothered to look up from filing her nails) said "Oh sorry, we've been very busy." It was 11 p.m. and the lobby was totally empty. In the morning, quite a few hotel guests were clustered in the lobby, waiting for the shuttle service that was half an hour late, not a good thing when folks have a plane to catch. It's unfortunate that the rating system doesn't allow for zero stars. To give this hotel a one star rating is overly generous. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills”
Reviews.Author: caterina02
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was in the side of the hotel that has recently been renovated. The bathrooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The only complaint we had was that the floors creaked a lot: the people upstairs were walking around at 6 am and we could hear every footstep. The view from the room was into someone's backyard. Overall, it was good for the location to SeaTac Airport and good as long as you just need the room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Think Again”
Reviews.Author: honolulumark
Reviews.Content: May be cheapest but better to spend extra $5 and stay elsewhere. They wont tell you that airport shuttle is shared with Holiday Inn and very hard to spot if it eventually comes. The rooms are stripped down, almost bleak. Hotel is next to a busy and noisy road, which makes sleeping a challenge. Front desk can have a big attitude problem, especially lady named ASHANTA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park and Fly Package”
Reviews.Author: RyanMarche
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night before the flight out and left the car here when we were gone. Only a few bucks more than the Super 8, but a much better hotel and parking was on site. Rooms are just renovated so they are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: dr_bob_bc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on either side of a week business trip. It was cheap, the room was freshly updated, and no problems. I had a late arrival on my return, and when I called from the courtesy phone, the shuttle was there within 10 minutes. I'm not a fussy guy, but for the price, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk people extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Islandsss
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the internet while searching for a reasonably priced place to stay during a layover at SeaTac. The good price, courtesy van and location sold the place. When calling the hotel and making the reservation, the front desk people were helpful. During the layover there were some logistical issues that the people at the front desk went out of the way to help with. I travel a great deal and do not normally experience such great help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jraz68
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves more than 1/1half stars. I stayed there two times., before my flight and on the return. The rooms were great and the staff very accommodating. If you want a nice hotel with a great price this is the place. I was a Director of Sales at a resort before I retired. I know great service and a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “airport stayover”
Reviews.Author: eliza111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night on a trip out of Sea Tac. Front desk girl was really nice and helpful and believe me, she had her hands full.The room was fine. Nothing special, but clean which is the main thing. We had a group of people in the room next to us that looked like they were going to be loud - if they were, we didn't hear much. I think I'd stay again, if the price was right - which it was this trip - 55$$ plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to crash before/after SeaTac flight”
Reviews.Author: Hither-and-yon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn for a night between flights. A complimentary shuttle arrived within minutes of ringing them on the courtesy phone at the airport. The reception area, like the building itself, is plain but functional. The front-desk night staff was friendly and kept registration simple to make it short. Our room was at the end of two long corridors (a new wing, by the looks of it). The room itself was a pleasant surprise: well-appointed, immaculately clean, comfortable beds, with little but thoughtful features that many more upscale places lack, such as a desk with conveniently located power and Ethernet outlets, a good desk lamp, a sink separate from the bathroom itself and – don't laugh – thick toilet paper and sensibly sized bath soaps. There are no coffeemaking facilities in the room and no dining room (just an area with drinks machines), and I can't vouch for the area, but if you need a clean and pleasant place to crash before or after a flight at SeaTac, this is worth considering. One downside: Boingo isn't one of the roaming internet options.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fine”
Reviews.Author: craggyair
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this place twice now, once by myself and once with my wife.
